page.title: 03CANALS, MOTORWAYS AND TRAINS
page.content: THERE ARE MANY WAYS OF TRAVELLING FROM LOWERHOUSE AND ROSEGROVE TO OTHER PLACES. THE LEEDS AND LIVERPOOL CANAL PASSES CLOSE TO OUR SCHOOL AND WE OFTEN SEE BARGES MOVING SLOWLY ALONG. FACTORIES WERE BUILT ALONG THE SIDES OF THE CANAL SO THAT THEIR FINISHED PRODUCTS COULD EASILY BE TRANSPORTED. THE NEW M65 MOTORWAY,OPENED 1982, NOW RUNS FROM NELSON TO BLACKBURN. MANY HOUSES WERE DEMOLISHED WHERE IT RUNS PARALLEL TO THE RAILWAY IN ROSEGROVE. ROSEGROVE RAILWAY STATION HAS NO TICKET OFFICE OR WAITING ROOM, YOU PAY WHEN YOU BOARD THE TRAIN. TRAINS RUN TO COLNE OR PRESTON. MANY PRIVATE VEHICLES TRAVEL PAST THE SCHOOL AND THEY CAN BUY PETROL AT THE LOCAL FILLING STATION FOR TWO POUNDS A GALLON.
